items.title: Access to X, YouTube other online platforms restricted in Turkey, internet monitor says
items.summary: ISTANBUL (Reuters) -Netblocks, a global internet monitor, said on Monday that access to online platforms including X, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok and WhatsApp has been restricted in Turkey on multiple networks. Read full story

items.title: South Korea minister heads to US to resolve fallout from huge immigration raid
items.summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Hyun will head to the U.S. on Monday as he seeks to resolve the fallout over the detention of hundreds of Korean workers during an immigration raid at a time when Seoul has committed to massive investment plans in America. items.title: More on the new Anker 25W Prime MagSafe stand with display: White model, Sleep/Ice Mode, and early-bird deal
items.summary:
The 25W Qi2.2 MagSafe charging stands are beginning to emerge. We detailed the UGREEN 2-in-1 and 3-in-1 models already – there are even some early deals live on those right now – as well as the new Belkin 25W charging stands that can power your entire Apple kit, but perhaps the most impressive-looking of them all is the new Anker variant. Complete with an onboard display similar to those on its existing Prime charging gear, it is thus far a one-of-a-kind and the official Anker site has some additional details and imagery up now (as well as an early bird deal). 

more…

items.summary:
Welcome to 9to5Toys Battlestation Weekly – your go-to spot for the notable deals and latest releases in PC gaming at a glance every Saturday morning. IFA 2025 is now in full swing, and we got a bunch of cool new gear like this Qi2.2 25W MagSafe charging station with detachable battery orbs and Anker’s new AI-powered voice recorder. We also stumbled upon seriously cool concepts that we’d love to see become real products someday. On top of that, we spotted a bunch of unmissable deal amidst all the IFA 2025 madness, many of which are still live and waiting for you below in this week’s Battlestation Weekly!

items.summary:
Now just days away from the official reveal from iPhone 17, excitement is ramping up for the next-generation Apple handsets (not to mention loads of leaked details and images over at 9to5Mac). For those looking to trade-up for the new model, or just pre-order one when everything goes live (likely next week), the ongoing slate of discounts on iPhone 15 and 16 are much less exciting, but for those looking for a deal there is as much as $730 in savings live right now courtesy of Amazon. 

more…

items.title: Electrified Weekly – Rad Power extra battery e-bike bundles from $1,499, exclusive and promotional new lows from EcoFlow, Anker, more
items.summary:
Welcome to 9to5Toys Electrified Weekly – the best place to find all of this week’s best deals and new releases to electrify your life and protect Mother Nature. Among our EV deals this week – which includes several EV chargers and charging stations seeing discounts – we’re seeing Rad Power Bikes start Fall strong with extra battery bundles on various e-bikes starting from $1,499. On that same note, Heybike is offering the second-ever extra battery bundle on its Mars 2.0 Folding e-bike for up to 90 miles of travel at its $1,199 low. We’re also seeing hangover Electric Bike Co. savings on its Model C and J e-bikes at $1,499 annual lows, and much more.

We also have quite the lineup of new releases and new low prices on power stations, like ALLPOWERS’ new SOLAX P100 Mini Power Station dropping to $69 with its first discount, as well as some exclusive and promotional lows on models from EcoFlow, Anker SOLIX, Jackery, Segway, and more. Head below to check out all the best Green Deals from this week.

items.title: Anker offering 30% off early bird deals on new Prime power banks and 25W MagSafe gear + FREE backpack
items.summary:
Yesterday as part of its IFA reveals, Anker debuted its new Prime power family. Ranging from the new 26,250mAh 300W Power Bank through to the new 160W 3-Port Anker Prime Charger, and the impressive-looking new 3-in-1 25W Prime Wireless Charging Station with AirCool tech and the built-in display, just about all of it is set to release on September 29, 2025, and there are some notable promotions inbound. Anker site is promising 30% off as part of the early bird perks alongside a FREE laptop bag worth $70 on select purchases. Scope out the details below.

All of the details on both of the new devices are, of course, waiting for you over at 9to5Google, but we are also tracking some notable early deals on both, including FREE double storage upgrades, up to $800 in trade-in credit, and some serious bundle opportunities too. All of this will also stack with your $50 reserve credit if you happened to take advantage there.

POKIPO Large Tool Organizer with Power Station

Buy for $56 (Reg. $66)

What we love

Finally get your workshop or garage in order with this affordable and spacious tool rack that’s currently discounted at Amazon. It wields a total of four tiers and can support “up to 600 pounds” of weight. Another perk I love here is that there is a 4-outlet power strip so you can easily top off batteries and more.

Normally, you’d be spending $200 or more on this model without any discounts, which has received few discounts over 2025, with the best of them dropping costs to $159. It’s all getting beaten out by today’s deal, which cuts $73 off the going rate for a new all-time low.

In the lead up to Labor Day weekend, B&H has been going crazy with the Mac deals. Delivering some of the best prices we have tracked all year on configurations you just can’t get at Amazon and Best Buy. One of the more interesting and standout offers here is on the 24GB M4 Mac mini at $699 shipped – this is not the $999 24GB model you can get at Amazon, but rather the most affordable 24GB configuration you can buy with a solid $100 price drop.

items.title: Ninja’s Flip 8-in-1 toaster oven and air fryer takes up less space while still covering 4-person meals at $150 annual low (Reg. $220)
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the Ninja Flip 8-in-1 Toaster Oven and Air Fryer back at $149.99 shipped, which matches the price we’re also seeing directly from the brand’s website. Normally going for $220 at full price, we saw discounts regularly take the price down to this same rate up until late May when things shifted and we only saw drops to $180. Now after three months the price is finally coming back down, and while we have seen it go lower in the past, you’re still looking at a solid $70 price cut to the best rate we’ve tracked in 2025.
